problem_type: Student identifies which fractions are improper (greater than 1) based on numerator/denominator relationship
workspace_description: Display showing three fractions: 5/4, 3/4, 2/3. No number line reference.
action_description: MCQ - Student selects one fraction from the options provided.
prompt: Which of these fractions is greater than 1?

problem_type: Student identifies which fractions are improper (greater than 1) based on numerator/denominator relationship
workspace_description: Display showing the fraction 5/4 prominently. Three explanation options presented below the fraction.
action_description: MCQ - Student selects one explanation from the options provided.
prompt: 5/4 is called an improper fraction. Why is it past 1?

problem_type: Student identifies which fractions are improper (greater than 1) based on numerator/denominator relationship
workspace_description: Display showing four fractions: 7/4, 4/3, 5/6, 3/4. No number line reference.
action_description: Multi-select - Student selects all fractions that meet the criteria.
prompt: Select all the fractions that are greater than one whole.

problem_type: Student identifies which fractions are improper (greater than 1) based on numerator/denominator relationship
workspace_description: Display showing two fractions side by side: 3/4 and 4/3. No number line reference.
action_description: MCQ - Student selects one fraction from the pair provided.
prompt: Which fraction is an improper fraction: 3/4 or 4/3?
